name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:**  The substantia propria is the stromal tissue of the conjunctiva underlying the epithelium.  The bulbar conjunctiva covers the eyeball, the palpebral conjunctiva lines the eyelids, and the forniceal conjunctiva covers the junction of the eyelid and eyeball.  The caruncle is the fleshy prominence at the inner corner of the eye lined by conjunctival epithelium.

**Note 3:**  Quadrants of involvement are coded in Site-Specific Factor 2.
rows:
Localized only

    Tumor(s) of bulbar conjunctiva
    Tumor involves:
          Caruncle
          Conjunctival fornix
          Palpebral conjunctiva

    Localized, NOS

        Cornea

        Orbit
